Email 1.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Tushar,
Received!  Thank you for your response and for updating the requested document. I appreciate your continued support.

Email 2.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Corinthea,

Please find attached updated statement for your further reference.
If any further requirements, we are always available.

Email 3.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Ravi,
Thank you for your response and clarification.  Yes, please provide an updated statement because the current statement has a “valid up to” date.  As always, thank you for your continued support.

Email 4.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Corinthea,

You are correct — the attached statement in this email is the accurate one.

The fatty acid used to produce Matpers RG 150 is indeed a derivative of palm.

Apologies for any confusion this may have caused, and thank you for bringing it to our attention. Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you need any further information.

If you require the same statement with an updated date, just let me know.

Email 5.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Ravi,
I have one more question.  We have two different origin statements on file (attached).  May I please ask for your assistance in confirming which statement is correct?  It was my assumption that this material is a derivative of palm oil.  Thank you and I look forward to your response.

Email 6.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Ravi,
Thank you for your response and for the confirmation.  Currently, no changes are needed.

Email 7.subject: RE: 188332 CQester 6000-DS (Matpers RG 150) → Matangi Industries LLP

body.text:
Hello Corinthea,

Good day and thank you for your email.
Please note that our current supplies of Matpers RG 150 are not sustainable source or RSPO-certified.
However, we are RSPO MB (Mass Balance) certified and can offer sustainably sourced material upon your request.
Please let us know if you would like us to proceed with RSPO MB-certified material for your requirements.
Please find attached our RSPO SCC certificate for your reference.

Hello Ravi and team,
I need your assistance please.  May I please ask if you could confirm if the palm kernel oil/palm oil  (the derivative) is from a sustainable source?  If yes, please provide the source. Examples: RSPO MB, RSPO IP, RSPO S.  As always, thank you for partnership and support.  I look forward to your response.
